alert.note: Alert for Central Colorado River Basin; Central Gunnison and Uncompahgre River Basin; Debeque to Silt Corridor; Flat Tops; Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys; Grand Valley; Grand and Battlement Mesas; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide; Upper Gunnison River Valley; West Elk and Sawatch Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 28 at 10:05AM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...SNOW SQUALL... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 35 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1004 AM MST, a snow squall was along a line extending from near New Castle to 9 miles east of Collbran to 13 miles southeast of Palisade to 20 miles northwest of Nucla to 7 miles west of Slick Rock and moving southeast at 20 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... New Castle around 1010 AM MST. Glenwood Springs around 1035 AM MST. Orchard City and Cedaredge around 1045 AM MST. Carbondale and Hotchkiss around 1100 AM MST. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 98 and 147. U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 49 and 88. Colorado 65 between mile markers 1 and 41. Colorado 82 between mile markers 1 and 23. Colorado 90 between mile markers 12 and 33. Colorado 92 between mile markers 1 and 27. Colorado 133 between mile markers 1 and 20, and between mile markers 29 and 68. Colorado 141 between mile markers 14 and 89, and near mile marker 92. Colorado 145 between mile markers 105 and 116. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
